intro: Lysimachia coriacea, commonly known as rough yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to regions of Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of pubescence, giving them a rough texture. Lysimachia coriacea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
